        Creates a new instance of the GameTimer class
        Parameters:
        duration - The duration the timer should run in seconds

      • GameTimer

        public GameTimer(float duration,
                 boolean autoStart)
        Creates a new instance of the GameTimer class
        Parameters:
        duration - The duration the timer should run in seconds
        autoStart - Sets the GameTimer to active if true

    • Method Detail

      • setDuration

        public void setDuration(float duration)
        Sets the amount of time in seconds that should elapse before the GameTimer is complete.
        Parameters:
        duration - The duration of the timer

      • setNextDuration

        public void setNextDuration(float duration)
        Sets the duration to a new value on the next call to reset. Allows for updating the duration properly from onComplete method
        Parameters:
        duration - The duration to use on the next timer run

      • getDuration

        public float getDuration()
        Return the amount of time in seconds the GameTimer should run for before completing.
        Returns:
        targetTime

      • reset

        public void reset(boolean resetFromLastEndTime)
        Resets the timer for another use.
        Parameters:
        resetFromLastEndTime - GameTimer should subtract the targetTime from the previously elapsed time of the timer.

      • resetRunCount

        public void resetRunCount()
        Call to reset the number of times the timer has run to 0

      • startGameTimer

        public void startGameTimer()
        Sets the GameTimer to active

      • endGameTimer

        public void endGameTimer()
        Forces a stop on the game timer.

      • isComplete

        public boolean isComplete()
        Returns if the GameTimer has completed running
        Returns:
        true if complete, otherwise false

      • setInterpolation

        public void setInterpolation(Interpolation interpolation)
        Sets the interpolation to apply to the percent complete returned by getPercentComplete()
        Parameters:
        interpolation - which interpolation to apply

      • getInterpolation

        public Interpolation getInterpolation()
        Returns the interpolation set to be used by getPercentComplete()
        Returns:
        interpolation

      • getPercentComplete

        public float getPercentComplete()
        Calculate the completion fraction.
        Returns:
        value between 0f and 1f, where 1f → complete

      • isActive

        public boolean isActive()
        Test whether the GameTimer is running
        Returns:
        true if running, otherwise false

      • getRunCount

        public long getRunCount()
        Read the number of times startGameTimer has been called on this timer
        Returns:
        count

      • setAutoRestart

        public void setAutoRestart(boolean autoRestart)
        For use with or without managed GameTimers. Enables auto restart of the timer after calling onComplete.
        Parameters:
        autoRestart - true → enable auto restart, false → disable it

      • getAutoRestart

        public boolean getAutoRestart()
        Test auto restart flag.
        Returns:
        true if timer resets and restarts after onComplete, otherwise false

      • setIsManaged

        public void setIsManaged(boolean isManaged)
        FOR INTERNAL USE ONLY. Do not call this method directly.
        Parameters:
        isManaged - desired setting for flag

      • getIsManaged

        public boolean getIsManaged()

      • update

        public void update(float tpf)
        Should be called each game loop
        Parameters:
        tpf - time interval between render passes (in seconds, ≥0)

        public void timerUpdateHook(float tpf)
